text: {| |} The Kamov Ka-8 "Иркутянин", (Irkutyanin - from Irkutsk), was a diminutive Soviet helicopter that first flew in 1947. It was a precursor of the Ka-10. The Ka-8 was a single-seat helicopter with a 27 hp M-76 engine, boosted to 45 hp by using alcohol for fuel. ==Specifications== ==References== ===Notes=== ===Bibliography=== * Apostolo, Giorgio. The Illustrated Encyclopedia of Helicopters. New York: Bonanza Books, 1984. . Category:Kamov aircraft Category:1940s Soviet military utility aircraft Ka-08 Category:Coaxial rotor helicopters
title: Kamov Ka-8
